text: Department of the Treasury Internal Revenue Service
This transmits new IRM 25.13.2, Taxpayer Correspondence, TE/GE Taxpayer Correspondence Procedures.

Tax Exempt and Government Entities

TE/GE Taxpayer Correspondence Procedures 25.13.2 page
Note: Letters for fewer than

recipients (over the lifetime of the letter) doesn’t need Office of Taxpayer Correspondence (OTC)/Media & Publications Pub- lishing (M&P) approval. TE/GE Communications & Liaison (TE/GE C&L) available to review these letters, if requested. (
) Audience : Tax Exempt and Government Entities employees who communicate directly with taxpayers. (
) Policy Owner : Commissioner, Tax Exempt and Government Entities. (
) Program Owner : Director, Communications and Liaison, Tax Exempt and ernment Entities. (
) Primary Stakeholders : • Chief Counsel • Office of Taxpayer Correspondence • Media and Publications Publishing • Taxpayer Advocate Service • TE/GE Division Counsel (

) Program Goals : TE/GE C&L coordinates correspondence approvals from OTC, ensuring that taxpayer correspondence includes plain language concepts before OTC submission. OTC then uses its staff of writers and OTC’s Chief Counsel Liaison to ensure that letters and notices are complete, accurate legally sufficient. (
) The IRS established OTC to ensure that taxpayer correspondence meets tablished standards and contains an IRS-wide look. (
) TE/GE C&L serves as the liaison between the TE/GE functional divisions, OTC and M&P. (

) Taxpayer Bill of Rights - Taxpayers have the right to know what they need do to comply with the tax laws. They are entitled to clear explanations of the laws and IRS procedures in all tax forms, instructions, publications, notices, and correspondence. They have the right to be informed of IRS decisions about their tax accounts and to receive clear explanations of the outcomes. (
) Plain Writing Act of
- The law requires federal agencies to use clear ernment communication the public can understand and use. (
) OTC’s responsibilities are described in IRM
Plain Writing Act of 2010 - The law requires federal agencies to use clear gov- ernment communication the public can understand and use.
TE/GE C&L oversees TE/GE’s interactions with OTC and M&P for all requests to revise or create IRS taxpayer correspondence.

To avoid unintentional use of outdated correspondence, link to the catalog page describing the correspondence, not directly to the correspondence.

Divisions Identify a Need Note: FCLs are listed as the Content Point of Contact in the product catalog. If the FCL changes, the TE/GE functional division will send the new FCL’s contact information to TE/GE C&L. TE/GE C&L will notify Publishing, who updates the catalog.
Within 15 days of the request, the FCL:
Step Action

) Reviews the Product Catalog Information and uses the View by Product Title Search to determine if correspondence exists that, with minor revisions, will adequately address the information to be conveyed to the taxpayer.
) If there is current correspondence, reviews or prepares a draft of the revisions to the current correspondence using the Stan- dardization Guidelines in Exhibit
) If we don’t have this correspondence, reviews or prepares a draft of the new correspondence using the Standardization Guidelines in Exhibit

• New – an issue that can’t be addressed by an existing letter or notice. • Revised – existing correspondence that needs technical clarity or adjustments for organizational requirements. This includes existing letter or notice corrections. Note: The FCL may work with the requestor or a functional SME to develop or revise correspondence, as needed.

The FCL completes Form14768, Request for New or Revised Correspondence, and emails it with a draft Word document of the correspondence to the Desig- nated Functional Approving Manager (DFAM) for approval.
TE/GE Taxpayer Correspondence Procedures 25.13.2 page

for any revised corre- spondence to the FCL within
calendar days of receipt. • Submits the draft Word document and Form
for any new spondence to the functional Director, who approves and returns the signed Form
to the DFAM, who returns it to the FCL within calendar days of receipt. (
) The FCL emails the approved Form
and draft Word ﬁle of the corre- spondence to TE/GE C&L at *TE/GE Letters & Notices with “Correspondence Request” in the subject line. (
) If the request is for expedited treatment, the request must include a valid business reason (for example, a law change) for the expedited treatment. (
) Within
calendar days of receiving the Form

and draft correspon- dence, TE/GE C&L will assign the request to a team member, who inputs request into the TE/GE Correspondence Clarity Tracker (Tracker) to every letter or notice requested, emails sent and received, and steps taken during the process. This includes TE/GE C&L’s actions, FCL’s inquiries, actions with the OTC and M&P, and TE/GE C&L project manager’s actions. Document these steps when they occur to avoid delaying the approval process. (
) The C&L team member: Step Action
) Reviews the Product Catalog Information to verify the need for correspondence revision/creation.
) Ensures that correspondence is drafted for cross-functional use, if applicable.
) Creates a new item on the Tracker.
) Submits a Publishing Services Request (PSR) for Repository and Correspondex letters (For CP Notices, skip to step

; a PSR is not used; OTC will process): • Request a new letter and catalog number (for new let- ters) • Include an official title of the letter and a descriptive paragraph about the letter’s use (found on Form
). • Attach a sample of the document (M&P will post the ﬁnal version received from OTC, not the initial version in- cluded with the PSR).
) Enters the PSR number and any new letter and catalog numbers on the Tracker and Form
) Edits the correspondence for plain language (see Form

, Plain Language Checklist and Review Sheet) and for other editorial changes (for example, format, punctuation and other minor changes) in accordance with the IRS Style Guide . The TE/GE C&L team members may send the correspondence to the TE/GE C&L project manager for review. (

Counsel Liaison can confer with TEGE Division Counsel, if needed). • The TAS response in the request for services submission (so OTC knows who to send the correspondence back during the ﬁnal approval stage). • A Word ﬁle of the latest version of the letter or notice. • A copy of the completed Form

• Notiﬁcation if the letter or notice includes a customer ac- counts service call back number. Enters the OTC Request for Services case number in the Tracker. Reviews OTC’s comments when the OTC Customer Account Manager (CAM) responds: • If wording was changed , sends the letter or notice to the FCL for approval. (FCL approval is generally needed only if the changes are other than format.) If the request is for expedited treatment, the FCL must return any comments or approval within two business days, or the letter or notice will be removed from the expedited treatment stream. • If no wording was changed or after the FCL returns the letter or notice, sends the letter or notice back to the CAM. Note: If OTC contacts the FCL directly, the FCL must include the C&L team member in any reply. Reviews OTC’s Chief Counsel Liaison’s comments (OTC’s Chief Counsel Liaison will consult with TEGE Division Counsel and other Counsel offices on TE/GE correspondence, as needed) the CAM sent. • If Counsel’s changes are only formatting, sends back to CAM as approved (if acceptable). • If Counsel’s changes affect wording, sends to FCL for approval before sending back to CAM.
TE/GE Taxpayer Correspondence Procedures 25.13.2
Step Action

) When everyone agrees on a ﬁnal version, CAM sends the TE/GE C&L team member a PDF ﬁnal draft, who submits it to the FCL and asks them to have the appropriate DFAM digitally sign the PDF letter or notice and return it to the TE/GE C&L team member, who returns it to CAM.

) CAM forwards new or revised PDFs (not CP notices) to M&P for publishing and to the TE/GE C&L team member. M&P creates a formatted PDF version of the correspondence and sends it to the TE/GE C&L team member, who will forward it to the FCL. If no formatting corrections are needed, the FCL digitally signs the PDF and returns it to the TE/GE C&L team member, who then returns it to M&P. If M&P contacts the FCL directly, the FCL must include the C&L team member in any reply.

) TE/GE C&L sends the new or revised notice or letter to the FCL, who sends it to BSP or other programmer to input into the system for general use. The FCL notiﬁes TE/GE C&L when the correspondence is ready for production and gives them a copy of the pre-production draft. TE/GE C&L reviews the pre- production draft for accuracy and notiﬁes BSP or the other programmer if the correspondence is approved for production. Taxpayer Correspondence systems include: • IDRS – CRX letters generate from the Entity, Accounts Management, Unpostables and ERS/Rejects Functions (Programs) • BMF – CP notices generate from Master File program- ming • EPMF – CP notices generate for programming • LINUS – Acknowledgement notices • MEDS – Acknowledgement notices • EDS – EP/EO determination letters • TRAC – MAPICS determination letters and acknowledg- ment letters • RCCMS – Various letters Note: Only repository letters are shown in the Product Catalog Information. Find CRX letters in SERP . Find CP notices in the Servicewide Notice Information Program ( SNIP ); they are not shown in the Product Catalog Information.

The FCL will sign up for an email notiﬁcation of new revisions for correspon

dence owned by another business division or TE/GE function that their functional area uses in the BSP systems. When a new revision is available, the FCL will provide a copy of the revised ﬁle to BSP so the new revision can be uploaded to the system.

The FCL will sign up for an email notiﬁcation of new revisions for correspon- dence owned by another business division or TE/GE function that their functional area uses in the BSP systems. When a new revision is available, the FCL will provide a copy of the revised ﬁle to BSP so the new revision can be uploaded to the system.
) for Obsoleting Correspondence (

) The TE/GE functional division identiﬁes correspondence that needs to be obsoleted. The FCL submits an email with a copy of the correspondence, the reason it should be removed and a contact person (if other than the FCL) to TE/GE C&L at *TE/GE Letters & Notices with “Obsolete Correspondence” in the subject line. The FCL searches irs.gov to determine whether it mentions the correspondence to be obsoleted and includes a snapshot of the search with the request to obsolete. (
) TE/GE C&L enters the correspondence into the Tracker. (

) TE/GE C&L notiﬁes the FCLs and the TE/GE functional division’s Examination, Determination, Compliance Unit and BSP functions of the request to obsolete correspondence and gives them two weeks to dispute the correspondence being obsoleted. (

) If no one objects during the two-week time frame, TE/GE C&L submits a Request for Services to OTC and a PSR to M&P to have the correspondence obsoleted in the product catalog. A Request for Services for a CRX letter remains open until the correspondence is ﬂagged obsolete in SNIP. The image stays in SNIP for historical reasons. TE/GE C&L notiﬁes the FCL that the cor- respondence has been obsoleted. The FCL emails BSP and asks them to remove the letter from the systems.
TE/GE Taxpayer Correspondence Procedures 25.13.2 page 9
Exhibit 25.13.2-1 (03-26-2021) Standardization Guidelines for TE/GE Letters
Use the following formatting standards when creating new or modifying existing forms/letters.

# Standard Requirement 1. RightsEnabled The document will have document rights enabled. 2 Formatting All TE/GE documents will be saved as Adobe dynamic XML form (.pdf). 3 Instruction Pages When instruction pages are present the following buttons will be included. 1. Hide Selectable Paragraph Pages 2. Show Selectable Paragraph Pages 3. Clear All Fields 4. Print Form The default state when the document is opened is to have the pages lectable paragraphs hidden. The Print Form button will be programmed to print the letter only and not selectable paragraph pages. 4 SelectiveParagraphs When selective paragraphs are present each paragraph will have a When checked, the text of the paragraph will be inserted/unhidden into main body of the letter. Selective Paragraphs page will include: Letter #### Do Not Mail This Page Selectable Paragraphs 5 Caption/labelformatting All caption/label ﬁelds in the Contact Information area will end with a 6 Order/formatting Right side header order for TE/GE letters: Date:Taxpayer ID number: or (Social Security Number (SSN) (Last 4 digits): Employer ID number:) Form:Planname/number: (include only if needed) Year ended/Issue date: (drop down, leave enough space for at least years) Person to contact: Manager’s contact information: (include only in initial contact letters) Response due date: (include only if needed) Appointment date and time: (include only if needed) Appointment location: (include only if needed) The captions are Arial point 8 bold, the user-entered text under the Arial 10 point regular. Each item must be a separate ﬁeld for RCCMS data import purposes.
All caption/label ﬁelds in the Contact Information area will end with a colon.
Exhibit 25.13.2-1 (Cont. 1) (03-26-2021) Standardization Guidelines for TE/GE Letters
TE/GE Taxpayer Correspondence Procedures 25.13.2 page
Exhibit 25.13.2-1 (Cont. 2) (03-26-2021) Standardization Guidelines for TE/GE Letters

The Person to contact ﬁeld will consist of multiple ﬁelds with the following default text: Name:IDnumber:Telephone:Fax: (include only if needed) Hours: (include only if needed) Toll-free: (only if needed) For RCCMS purposes, set each line with a caption and a value ﬁeld. The caption will be hard coded, the second will be ﬁllable for RCCMS data mapping. Field will be ﬁxed size to the right margin. Field will be set to expand/collapse up/down. Note: This will always be the
nd contact information ﬁeld, following Date. All contact information ﬁelds, even those not referenced here, will expand/ collapse up/down.
Note: This will always be the 2nd contact information ﬁeld, following Date. All contact information ﬁelds, even those not referenced here, will expand/ collapse up/down.

Field will be ﬁxed size to the right margin. Field will be set to expand/collapse up/down. The caption/label will be Appointment date and time: The following editable text will be contained in the expand/collapse ﬁeld:Date: [Month Day, Year]. Time: [Time a.m./p.m., time zone].
Exhibit 25.13.2-1 (Cont. 3) (03-26-2021) Standardization Guidelines for TE/GE Letters
Body text of letter will be Times New Roman 12 point regular.

All embedded text ﬁelds (for example, date, dollar amount) within a paragraph in the main body of a letter will be set to expand/collapse left/right. Inline date ﬁelds must expand to ﬁt longest month day year spelled out. (September 30, 2014).
